alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 26 at 8:17AM CDT until October 29 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Trempealeau River at Dodge affecting Buffalo and Trempealeau Counties. .The river rise at Dodge is lower than previous forecasts, but is forecast to reach Minor Flood Stage late Saturday night into Sunday morning. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT TO SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Trempealeau River at Dodge. * WHEN...From late Saturday night to Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, The railroad bridge about three quarters of a mile upstream from the gage can restrict the flow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 930 PM CDT.
